{"step_by_step_thinking": "Calculus is a hard, mineralized deposit that forms on the teeth. It is also known as tartar. Altered cementum is a part of the tooth that has been changed due to disease or injury. The area of the tooth that is covered by these substances would be the area where dental instruments would be used to remove them. Therefore, it is referred to as the instrumentation zone.", "answer_choice": "C"}
